info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 07 at 6:17AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A THUNDERSTORM WITH TORRENTIAL RAINFALL WILL IMPACT SPARTANBURG AND NORTHWESTERN CHEROKEE COUNTIES UNTIL 700 AM EDT... At 615 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm with intense lightning and torrential rainfall 4 miles northeast of Spartanburg, or near Cowpens, moving northeast at 20 mph. Locations to be impacted include... Spartanburg, Gaffney, Boiling Springs SC, Cowpens, Mayo, Cowpens National Battlefield, USC Upstate, Cedar Springs, Chesnee and Pacolet Mills. Very heavy rainfall rates up to 1 to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas, with deep ponding of water developing on area roadways.
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters. Occasional lightning is occurring with this storm. If outdoors, try to get indoors or into a hard topped vehicle. Otherwise, stay away from open areas and isolated high objects such as trees.
